intro: Clidemia vittata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or tropical nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas such as tropical forests and along stream banks. It has a rapid growth rate and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions. Its leaves contain irritants that can cause skin reactions in humans and animals.
